instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message: Hello. This board came to me about 2 months ago dead. Shorted PPBUS_G3H. I fixed the short and the board worked for the next 1 or 2 months. Last week costumer brought it back with a strange symptom. If the machine is left off for about 10 minutes it starts one time. No matter if you leave it on for 5 seconds or 1 hour, if you shut it down it won't power again immediately. If I leave it sitting on the bench for some minutes it turns on again for one time and does the same. When it stops working I have quarter fan spin. All S0 coils pulse during the quarter fan except the CPU VCORE ones. Any ideas?

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message: Does it start in SMC bypass then?

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message: It doesn't

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message: Check the PCH's RTC signals at that moment.

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message: While trying SMC bypass or while it does quarter fan?

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message:
PCH_SRTCRST_L - 3.34V
PPVOUT_G3_PCH_DCPRTC - 1.552V

This while quarter fanning. I don't know if these are the voltages you asked. Correct me if I'm wrong.

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message:
Sorry, if there is quarter fan spin, then RTC signals should be good.

ALL_SYS_PWRGD pulsing?
Inspect R7402/03 and solders around U7400.

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message: Resistors are good. Re-flower U7400 pressing it down with tweezers and touched pins with iron to make sure it's not solder problem. Same thing. First time I plug in the board it turns on. If I unplug and plug it in right after it won't turn on, just quarter fan. If I let it sitting on the bench for some minutes it'll turn on again once and do the same thing. ALL_SYS_PWRGD pulses when quarter fan.

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message:
Check for corrosion near U5750 and U5010.
Change C5001, just in case.

Same thing happens if you keep keyboard disconnected?

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message: Replaced the cap, no corrosion around both chips. Same results... I'm testing the board on the bench, no peripherals attached.

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message: It's not even turning on at first time anymore, just quarter fan spinning.

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message:
Reball SMC.
Seems that something reacted to heat when changed C5001.

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message: Reballed. Same thing. Quarter fan, cycling.

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H and 3V3_S5/SUS stable?
Still not turning on in SMC bypass?

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message: Replaced SMC. Now I only get quarter fan. Machine enter S0 state, all rails present except CPU VCORE.

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message:
Quarter fan spin and S0 present only that moment (I suppose)?
R7402/03 both good?

SMC from donor board, same model?
Be sure to have good solders.

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message: No! I plug in the charger, fan tries to spin but does not. S0 rails stay present until I disconnect charger. SMC from same model. R7402 and 03 reading accurately.

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message:
You get quarter fan spin and all voltages remain present after that (except VCORE)???
This is really strange.

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message: Yes, it's REALLY weird! But that's what's happening... It dos not get even a quarter fan, just as if the fan would start but does not. Just a little "unparking"(know this word does not exist, but still...). And all rails except VCOR remain ON.

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message:
Possibly PCH, or CPU issue.
Heat both with quality flux; may be just accumulated crap underneath.

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message: Ok! Will do it. Any suggestions on temperature and time?

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message: 180-200 degrees for 15-20s; no need to melt the balls.

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message: Tried. Same thing. I noticed high consumption of current on L7510 and L7520(around 4.5 amps) when injecting 1V on those coils. If I remove Q7520 and Q7510 it draws only 0.75 amps on bench PSU. Tried replacing both mosfets, still same abnormal consumption. I think there may be a short to GND before mosfets.

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message: Post exact ohm resistance to ground at L7510/20.

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message:
L7510:

Black Probe on GND: 0.2Ohms
Red Probe on GND: 0.3 Ohms

L7520:

Black Probe on GND: 0.3Ohms
Red Probe on GND: 0.3 Ohms

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message: I replaced U7400 and Q7510 and short gone, no more abnormal current consumption but no power! Just green light, no more S0 state. Resistance to GND raised to 1.4 Ohms on both coils.

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message:
Is your CPU i7-3xxx?
Compare readings with similar board.

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message: It's an Ivy Bridge i5

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message: Reading a bit lower than other similar board I have here. Now it's reading 2 Ohms and 2.3 ohms respectively, against around 3 Ohms from other board. I think CPU may be OK.

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message:
Checked on other board with i5 too?

Maybe bad PCH, or CPU; which reacted after heat applied.

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message: Yes, the other board is an i5 too. Both 2.5GHZ

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message: Dead CPU then?

threads.title: 820-3115 Quarter Fan
threads.message: If you have time to spend and experiment, change PCH first.
